news.title: China defends rare earth export curbs as ‘legitimate,’ hits back at U.S. tariffs as Trump-Xi meeting hangs in balance
news.summary: The controls are part of Beijing's effort to "better safeguard world peace and regional stability," it says. The Chinese Ministry of Commerce said the controls, issued Oct. 9, were part of a global effort.

news.title: Market sell-off: Trump post lops off $2 trillion from stocks in a single day
news.summary: The unraveling shows the sway the president's one-man trade policy still has over the fate of the global economy. It also shows the power of the U.S. dollar against other currencies.

news.title: Trump says administration has 'identified funds' to pay troops during shutdown
news.summary: President Donald Trump says his administration has "identified funds" to pay troops next week. The federal government is shut down because of the budget impasse.

news.title: Global week ahead: Three-speed Europe heads to Washington D.C.
news.summary: Diverging economic fortunes in Europe come at a time when the bloc should put on a united front on U.S. relations, experts say.

news.title: OpenAI's dominance is unlike anything Silicon Valley has ever seen
news.summary: OpenAI's position at the heart of the AI boom, and its expansion up and down the stack, is putting it in competition with a growing list of startups.

news.title: ‘I’d hate to turn her over to the state’: My mother, who has dementia, refuses to be put in a facility. What can we do?
news.summary: “She has never been willing to sign a power of attorney,” her attorney says. “She’s never been able to get her way.”

news.title: Is the stock market open on Columbus Day/Indigenous Peoples’ Day? Does the post office deliver mail?
news.summary: Be prepared for plenty of closures on Monday. There will be a lot of traffic on the East Coast on Monday and Tuesday. It will also be busy on the West Coast on Tuesday.

news.title: Be ready with these portfolio changes if the shutdown damages the Fed’s credibility
news.summary: The Fed is making decisions without actual data. Investors are still banking on rate cuts. The Fed is not releasing any new data on the state of the economy.

news.title: Inflation was out of control in retirement, so I went back to work. I’m still working at 66. Was I right?
news.summary: “Be more concerned with outliving inflation than Social Security,” he says. “I’m not worried about Social Security. I’d rather be alive than dead.”

news.title: ‘I’m stumped’: I put $3,000 on my credit card during a vacation and my credit score plunged. Why is it so volatile?
news.summary: “Doesn’t a 30-year history of good credit count for anything?” he asks. ‘Doesn't a 30 year history ofgood credit count?’ “I’m not sure,’ he adds.
